explanation: The correct angle notation requires three points: the vertex (E) and one point on each side (C and G), forming ∠CEG. The student identified only the vertex point (E), omitting the two additional points needed to specify the sides of the angle. This reflects a failure to recognize that angles are defined by two rays originating from a common vertex, necessitating three-letter notation. The error aligns with the misconception that a single point suffices to uniquely identify an angle, rather than requiring explicit reference to the sides. This is distinct from using two letters (which would describe a line segment) or mislabeling a wider angle (which would involve incorrect side points). The student's single-letter response directly stems from conflating the vertex with the complete angle descriptor.
